subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The wee hours of the morning. [5 Attachments]
author: Tim Woolworth
full_text:
I did not hear anything in the last three of these clips.  But, the first
one had some great communication.  I did not hear what you heard, but the
following was quite clear to me:

.06 receive you
.07 we're going home, home, home
.09 Forgive us (followed by two unclear words)

But we all hear this stuff different because of differences in speakers and
ears.

Tim


On Sun, Oct 24, 2010 at 4:41 AM, Frank Sumption
<purplealiengirl@...>wrote:

>
>  [Attachment(s) <#12bdd677873a4a36_TopText> from Frank Sumption included
> below]
>
>  While waitng for glue and varnish to dry on the box I was working, went to
> Good Will and found this tuner, a Toyota with not tape deck or CD player.
> The thing wouldn't turn on so I could get he pin out form measuring
> voltages, but I had the pin out for the AM tuner in my notes from 2006, so
> that is waht's use here. I wanted to make the smallest possible dual supply
> random sweep box that I could. Dual supply cuz random doens't work so great
> on sinlge supply and single supply requires more parts, even for linear
> sweep.
>
>  I tuned the radio between statiosn cuz this tuner is sensitive enough to
> get distant AM stations even in my garage. You can use AM skip as the raw
> audio. On the first one at 2 seconds "we're talklin' to Frank", at 4 seconds
> " I saw Frankie(my son) with you" and at the end "Frank Believe". In the
> second on at 3 seconds "f--you purple", and at 13 seconds "we've go to end
> with Bruce".
>
>  F-S
>
>  
>
